Author: gilardh#8348
Content: @radix42 The latest Raspberry pi 3 (model B, B + and, A +) uses an ARMv8. Why would you try to port  the Komodo version on ARMv7? I will try to install soon a full node and a block explorer on a raspberry pi 3 but I do not have as much knowledge as you.

Author: radix42#3743
Content: They do not have all of the arm v8 crypto extensions, which cost extra to license for the processor, and are effectively arm v7 for things that use cryptographic instructions

Author: Max21#6308
Content: Hi, is someone using the claiming tool from @lukechilds for Ledger?

Author: Max21#6308
Content: I've used it succesfully once in the past, but now I'm not able to claim any rewards

Author: Max21#6308
Content: https://imgur.com/a/DbwE0RH

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content: locktime needs to be green check, so you should send all to your self same address

Author: Max21#6308
Content: The tool is supposed to do that for me right ?

Author: Max21#6308
Content: I don't understand why locktime is red

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content: whatever sent the original transaction that created that utxo did not include locktime, so it has not been accruing the reward. you have to make a utxo with a wallet that sets the locktime correctly. (also the utxo has to be >= 10 KMD). if you send it to yourself and you see green check there then it should be good to start accruing, then you can come back in a month

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content: btw withdrawals from bittrex seem to set the locktime correctly

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Max21 previously if you sent coins from the ledger, the change output that would be sent back to you would not have nlocktime set. This meant as soon as you spent a UTXO from the ledger, the change back to it would not accrue rewards. This issue is fixed in Ledger Live 1.5. If it's still not set, update then send your full balance back to yourself. It will begin to accrue rewards.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @lukechilds fixed it üòç

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content: Has anybody experienced this? I was going to use the Ledger KMD Reward Claim website on github, and all the addresses and amounts look correct, but when the ledger nano device showed the fee it was some absurd amount like billion+ KMD

Author: phideas#8309
Content:
Ledger Reward Claim is broken? @lukechilds Could you take a look? If you need more info, just ping me I can assist to help.
https://imgur.com/a/P9nwhml

Author: phideas#8309
Content:
I managed to claim, but there something weird going on for sure. I have 5 KMD accounts on Legder so i tested 5x the claim process.

This bug popped up  when I waited couple of seconds while reading the adress on Ledger display before first confirm. After 1st confirmation,
the second confirm (output #1) never showed up on Ledger and the claim timed out with the bug screenshoted above. Tested on multiple accounts.

Bug didn't showed up and I was able to succesfully claim rewards when I was confirming the address immediately (couldn't even read).
After quick 1st confirm (address) the Output #1 and Output #2 showed ok and the claim was successful.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I haven't tested claiming on the atomiclabs app but i'll try it out later

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content: Ah, I think the reason the ledger nano s display shows a bajillion KMD fee for the claim is because the fee in the transaction is negative. Maybe this is the mechanism it uses to pull the reward "out of thin air", a negative fee.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @LeshAft9 you need to update the firmware of the device

Author: Alright#0419
Content: As far as I know, that bug was cosmetic only, but it's fixed now if you update the firmware

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content: Ah, right. I'd been avoiding that because of the loss of space on the device issue. Thanks. ButI did notice on the block explorer that it shows a negative fee rate and fee which I was wondering about
